model_solution:
Step 1:  The formula for the combination of n items taken r at a time is given by $\dbinom{n}{r} = \dfrac{n!}{r!(n-r)!}$.
 
$\dbinom{15}{2} = \dfrac{15!}{2!(15-2)!}$
Step 2: $\dbinom{15}{2} = \dfrac{15!}{2!(15-2)!} = \dfrac{15!}{2!\cdot 13!}$
Step 3: $= \dfrac{15\cdot14\cdot13!}{2!\cdot 13!}$
Step 4: $= \dfrac{15\cdot14\cdot13!}{2!\cdot 13!} = \dfrac{15\cdot 14}{2}$
$= \dfrac{210}{2}$
$= 105$
$= \dfrac{210}{2}$
Step 5: $= \dfrac{210}{2} = 105$
$= \dfrac{210}{2}$

full_steps:
Step 1:  The formula for the combination of n items taken r at a time is given by $\dbinom{n}{r} = \dfrac{n!}{r!(n-r)!}$.
 
$\dbinom{15}{2} = \dfrac{15!}{2!(15-2)!}$
